meanings.definition: To turn or twist to one side
meanings.sent1: She skews the painting slightly to the left for a better view.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind skews the tree branches in different directions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat skews the toy mouse out of reach.
meanings.sent4: His biased opinion skews the facts in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The artist skews reality in his abstract paintings.

meanings.definition: To cause to be biased or distorted
meanings.sent1: The misleading advertisement skews the consumer's perception.
meanings.sent2: Her personal feelings often skew her judgment in important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The funhouse mirror skews your reflection into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The foggy lens skews the view of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The unreliable source skews the information presented.

meanings.definition: A slanting or oblique movement or direction
meanings.sent1: The car took a sharp skew on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: The ski slope has a slight skew to the left at the end.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected skew in the dance routine made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sudden skew of the ball caught the goalkeeper off guard.
meanings.sent5: The building's design includes a unique skew in its architecture.
